speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Good morning, thank you for calling ISS Insurance Ltd. My name is Sarah, how may I help you today?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Oh, hello Sarah! Good morning to you too! Ai yah, finally got through, the line was busy just now, must be popular lah, ISS! Anyway, I'm Mrs. Lim, calling about travel insurance. We're planning a big family trip, very exciting! First proper holiday since... forever, feels like! My daughter just finished her PSLE, you know? Stressful time for everyone, so this trip is much needed!

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Congratulations to your daughter, Mrs. Lim! A family holiday sounds wonderful after all that hard work. I can certainly help you with information about travel insurance. To start, could you tell me where you'll be traveling to?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, yes! We're planning a trip to **Japan**! Never been, always wanted to see the cherry blossoms, but wrong season lah, this time. Still, so much to see! Temples, food... oh, the food! My husband is already dreaming about the ramen. We'll be traveling from **Singapore**, of course.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Japan is a fantastic choice, Mrs. Lim. And how long will your trip be?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: We'll be away for **2 weeks**. Long enough to relax but not so long that the plants at home die, hopefully! My neighbour promised to water them, very kind lady, her son is in the same class as my youngest... Oh dear, sorry, I'm rambling! Two weeks, yes.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Not at all, Mrs. Lim! It's lovely to hear about your plans. And how many people will be traveling in total?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: There will be **4** of us traveling. Me, my husband, and our two kids. The kids are teenagers now, always hungry, always on their phones!

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, four travelers going to Japan for two weeks. Could you give me a rough idea of the age group for the travelers?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Let's see... my husband and I, we're in the **41-55** age group, I suppose! Makes me feel old saying it! The kids are 14 and 16. So mostly adults, you could say.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood. And are you planning any specific activities during your trip? Sometimes people plan for skiing, diving, or other adventures.

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Oh, yes! That's one thing my son is super excited about. We want to try **White Water Rafting**! Found a place near one of the national parks. Looks a bit scary for me, but they say it's safe, guided and all. So yes, we definitely need coverage for **White Water Rafting**, just in case someone takes an unexpected swim, haha! You know, for any accidents during those **sports and adventure activities**.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Alright, noted. Coverage for white water rafting. Are there any specific medical considerations I should be aware of? For example, any pre-existing conditions or medical equipment you might be traveling with?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Ah, good you asked. My husband has **high blood pressure**, it's managed with medication, very stable lah. Do we need to declare **high blood pressure**? Also, he uses one of those **CPAP machine** things at night for sleeping. Does the insurance cover anything if the machine gets lost or damaged? More importantly though, is the general **medical coverage** good? You know, just in case someone gets sick overseas â€“ doctor visits, hospital stays, that kind of thing. Touch wood, of course! But better be safe, right? Last time my cousin went overseas, got food poisoning, the bill was horrendous!

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, I've noted the high blood pressure and the CPAP machine. And yes, understanding the general medical coverage is important. What about your luggage? Any specific concerns there?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Oh my goodness, yes! **Lost or damaged luggage**! My friend, she went to Europe last year, waited hours at the carousel, bag never came out! Total nightmare. Had to buy everything new. Imagine that happening in Japan! So definitely need good cover if our bags get lost, or delayed even. You know, for buying essentials if the bags take a holiday on their own!

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Understood, coverage for luggage is a common requirement. And what about unexpected delays during your travel itself? Like flight delays?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Hai-yah, don't remind me! Last time we flew to Bangkok, stuck on the tarmac for 3 hours, then missed our connecting transport! Such a headache. So yes, **travel delays** cover is important too. If we get stuck somewhere, need money for extra hotel night or meals, you know? Makes the stress a bit less.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, cover for travel delays. And one more area people often consider is trip cancellation. Is that something you'd like included?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Aiyo, **trip cancellation**, yes please! So much money we're spending on flights and hotels already. What if, touch wood again, one of us gets really sick before we go? Or maybe some family emergency back home? Cannot imagine losing all that money. So cover for cancelling the trip for reasons like illness or emergencies is a must-have for peace of mind.

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Certainly. Peace of mind is key. Lastly, do you have a particular budget in mind for the insurance policy itself?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Mmm, budget... We haven't fixed an exact amount, but ideally, we're hoping to spend maybe **$200-$300** for the four of us? Around that range would be good. Is that realistic for Japan for two weeks with the rafting?

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: Okay, noted the budget preference. So, just to quickly recap, Mrs. Lim. You're looking for travel insurance for 4 travelers (mostly in the 41-55 age group, plus two teens) traveling from Singapore to Japan for 2 weeks. You require coverage for potential **Trip Cancellation**, **Travel Delays**, comprehensive **Medical Coverage** (noting a pre-existing condition of high blood pressure and travel with a CPAP machine), **Lost/Damaged Luggage**, and specific **Sports and Adventure Activities** coverage for White Water Rafting. Your preferred budget is around $200-$300. Does that sound correct?

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Yes, Sarah, that's perfect! You got everything. See, talking it through helps so much! I feel much clearer now about what we need. You've been very patient, thank you! Unlike trying to explain things to my teenagers sometimes...

speaker: Customer Service Agent
dialogue: You're very welcome, Mrs. Lim! I'm glad I could assist in clarifying your requirements today. These details will help us identify suitable options for you. Thank you for calling ISS Insurance. Have a wonderful day and enjoy planning the rest of your exciting trip to Japan!

speaker: Customer
dialogue: Thank you so much, Sarah! You too, have a lovely day! Bye bye!
